title: Triangles and Congruence
content:
Module 3, Lesson 2: Triangles and Congruence

Introduction

This lesson covers Triangles and Congruence within the broader study of Geometry Fundamentals. Mastering these concepts will give you a solid foundation for subsequent lessons and real-world applications.

Key Concepts

1. Core Definitions

We begin with precise definitions that form the bedrock of Triangles and Congruence. A rigorous understanding of terminology prevents ambiguity and enables exact communication and proof.

2. Fundamental Theorems and Results

The central theorems of Triangles and Congruence provide powerful tools for solving problems. We state each result clearly, explain the intuition behind it, and work through representative examples.

3. Worked Examples

Each concept is illustrated with step-by-step worked examples. Pay close attention to the reasoning at each step — it is as important as the final answer.

4. Common Misconceptions

Students often confuse closely related ideas in Triangles and Congruence. We highlight these distinctions explicitly so you can avoid common errors in exams and practical work.

Summary

You have completed the study of Triangles and Congruence in Module 3 (Geometry Fundamentals). The key ideas covered in this lesson will be built upon in subsequent lessons. Attempt the quiz to consolidate your understanding before moving on.
